reviews.text: A good place to have an afternoon coffee and roam around after school.  My favorite is the food truck selling pommes frites.

The Old Town Hall on Bonn's marketplace was built 1737-1780 in the style of the Rococo by the electoral court architect Michael Leveilly. The three-storey building has a mansard roof with dormers. It is listed as an architectural monument. In the Square about a day in a week there's a Market...
Good place to have some coffee or buy cheap grocery
Very nice building

Absolutely gorgeous town hall located on the market off Bonn. On the market you can buy some great food and when it is sunny have a nice cool drink on the terraces. It is easily reachable on foot and bus, tram and metro stops aren't far away.
The Münster is undergoing repairs and renovation as of February 2019. This shot is from the square. A good place to hang out for a bit.
Looks very nice. But was under.renovation

Cool place at the city center. 
I visited few times with my friend. Its very quite and relaxed. Everyone who visit Bonn, should at least see this place. A photo graph is necessary:)
Very good place to visit!
A nice church to visit in Bonn
One of the best universities in Germany. Recently they received six "Clusters of Excellence" funding. It's more than any other university in Germany.
It is not good or not bad
One of the best university for international relations.

It is small but really a beautiful University. The main building is historical and used to be a palace. It is really nice to hang out on the grassland in front of the Uni. You will see many people playing something, taking a sunbath, or just simply taking a nap.
Good université 😚😍

Old, very old, must be one of the best and most interesting cemeteries in Germany. Beethoven's mother and composer Schumann were buried as well as many other celebrities.  A real place to be in nature and discover history.  Good transport by the Bonn local system.

Beautiful old graveyard with a lot of old tombstones. All entrances are closed except for the eastern entrance. There is a bus, tram and metro stop on 400 meters of the entrance. Be respectful because it is still being used by today.
such a great place to die
R.I.P. TUPAC R.I.P: BIGGIE
A must see if you are interested in the history of Bonn and the famous people who have lived here.

Zeer de moeite waard om te bekijken. De kerk bestaat uir 2 etages. Vroeger zat het gewoone volk beneden en het voorname volk boven. De kerk is bijzonder in dat opzicht. Er staat boven ook nog een doopsteen en het orgel. Prachtig!
sehr interessanter ungewöhnlicher Bau. unbedibgt sehenswert.

Tolle Kirche, von Innen und Aussen- Die haben sich auch sehr viel Mühe bei der Restauration gegeben, und haben den ganzen Platz neu angelegt und sogar große Steinplatten gesetzt um es für Rollstuhlfahrer barrierefrei zu machen.
Ein denkwürdiger  Ort

Perfect place to take a walk and breath some fresh air. You can see the small lakes with the swans. Also there is a small Japanese garden were you can see nice fishes. There are small Kiosk where you can buy a beer or ice cream and enjoy the sun.  Also if is sunny you can make  a grill ( there are zones to do so)

First of all, can I just say that this place is HUGE! My classmates and I went here for a simulation activity and we walked around the park the whole day but still we were not able to cover the whole area.  It's a beautiful park with lots of animals in the wild.  Great for family bonding or afternoon walks in solitude.

Rheinaue is always worth a trip. The former gardening exhibition area is now a beautiful park with wide paths allowing many opportunities for sports, recreation and meeting friends. Since February, Rheinaue also boasts a parkrun. Every Saturday, 9 am from the Baseball stadium.
This is the last part that is great for walking or biking. Amazing wildlife to observe and beautiful lush green lawns. Truly enjoyed my walking meditation here
Very very nice place to visit in family. Good to make some sport, specially running. The children will love it.
Nice place to visit for Nature lovers.
Nice place for to be with Family.
Wwww
Excellent place for an outing in the woods or for cycling!
brilliant and well protected with a dreamy hiking loop

Beautiful villa also nicknamed 'the White House on the Rhine'. It serves as the official residence of the President of the Federal Republic of Germany when in Bonn. The Villa is not accessible to the public, but appointment visits are possible. More information at the Bonn-Information.
Beautiful place
Leider kann man nicht sehr viel sehen.
Imposant aber leider so gut wie gar nicht ein zu sehen
Schömer Tag gewesen, sehr interessant zudem!
Worth to Visit museum. Free for students

The museum has a good collection of ancient pieces (pottery, coins, artworks...). You have also studies and copies of famous sculptures.
It is NOT a "must go", but if you are around, it is defnitely a good option.
And of course, IT IS FREE FOR STUDENTS!
Nice.
Toll.

Wie die meisten antiken Museen ist auch dieses enttäuschend. Das ist der, das ist jene, so wurde das gefunden, bzw dazu diente das. Aber wie das Menschsein war, dass man so darstellen wollte, wie man Schönheit sah, warum es keinen Verfall, kein schicksalsgezeichnet sein gab, fehlt auch hier.
Man schaue sich zum Vergleich andere Zeitalter und die Moderne an. Was ist das Bild des Menschen heute, das Künstler zum Ausdruck bringen. Da diese Gedanken angeregt werden, gehe ich wohl Noch einmal hin.

This is a place of great historical significance which we should treasure for future generations. The house is original and so small and old. But they have added next door some modern elements to enhance the experience. The building is in the middle of Bonn and so close to restaurants and other entertainment.

Well can say was there seen it! But really it’s just his house and a bunch of furniture and instruments. Maybe more interesting if you speak German, but for the non speaking, like myself, a bit boring. The interactive concert in the basement is the best part, but a little too long, I think it really needs a look into to make it a lot more appealing.

Worth visiting for classical music and local history lovers. 
You can' t understand a word unless you know good Deutsch, must rent audio guides available at the front desk.

The building makes for a nice little walk around to see Beethoven’s instruments, diaries and portraits of his family. It was a shame that all the panels were in German only, however. The 3D interactive opera also made for interesting, yet now quite outdated viewing. €4.50 per student ticket is a little steep for anyone but big Beethoven fans, I think.
Very good indeed. Some really fascinating exhibits. Just wish there were more detailed descriptions for some of the exhibits in languages other than Dutch.

Great museum to learn about German history after WW2. Basically the founding of Modern Day Germany. FREE ADMISSION! The downside is, almost everything is German language, but it is a museum, so you can also just look at the exhibits.

One of the best museums I've ever seen. The museum takes you through a surreal journey about journey of Germany after World War 2, which definitely deserves attention and is immensely inspiring. The musuem doesn't just talk Germany in itself but also how it was affected by other developments in the world. Highly recommended!
Very extensive collection, visual material and elaborative text was splendid. The interactions between staff and visitors was good. Only downside were the very high prices in the museum restaurant
If you are a history buff, you'll love this place. Traces the history of Germany (West, East and unified) from the end of the second world war to the present.

Visited it twice, each time I found something different that was interesting. Would definitely recommend! Typically the fact that the museum has no entry fee means that the expositions are not so great, but it's not the case with this one.

Wonderful museum! I think all of the animals existing on the world were there. The fact that they have grouped them according to their habitats was really nice, and the habitats themselves were really realistically built. This is indeed a must-see in Bonn. However, they lack some English explanations in some parts, but I think this doesn't affect the joy. Tickets were €5 for adults and €2.5 for discounted (children, students etc). Go find your favourite animal in the world :)

Went here with my friend.  It was one of the most affordable museums I've been to in Europe.  It was smaller compared to other museums but it had a great collection.  My friend and I enjoyed our time inside exploring the different exhibits.  The staff are friendly and good looking. Hahaha!

The museum has a great collection of varieties of animals, birds, insects in model forms. It seems that the models of the creatures have been made by stuffing. Synthetically created background environment looks very real. Entry fee is 5 Euro per head and for the students with ID card entry fee is discounted to 2.5 euros. The ticket is valid for the whole day. There is a memento shop in the ground floor. Some descriptions of the collection is written only in German. As a whole it is a nice place to visit.

Really enjoy my visit here . Lots of real animals (dead of course) on display in context of their ecology and done really really well. Also individual real animals simply on display and other information on history of the earth. Info mainly in German.
Super pretty place, super interesting info although most of it is in German. The entrance fee is cheap, I would totally recommend seeing all these amazing creatures!
Very nice place to stay for a while to get the best way to go through it
Kleines und interessantes Museum zur Beueler Geschichte mit engagierten ehrenamtlichen Führern. Auch eine Trauung in der Scheune des Museums kann ich aus eigener Erfahrung empfehlen. 🙂
Sehr schön und liebevoll gemacht... War mal schön es zu sehen.. 👍
War ein schöner Besuch meine Tochter fand die Puppen am schönsten....
Lohnt sich mal hin und gehen

This is a place of great historical significance which we should treasure for future generations. The house is original and so small and old. But they have added next door some modern elements to enhance the experience. The building is in the middle of Bonn and so close to restaurants and other entertainment.

Well can say was there seen it! But really it’s just his house and a bunch of furniture and instruments. Maybe more interesting if you speak German, but for the non speaking, like myself, a bit boring. The interactive concert in the basement is the best part, but a little too long, I think it really needs a look into to make it a lot more appealing.

Worth visiting for classical music and local history lovers. 
You can' t understand a word unless you know good Deutsch, must rent audio guides available at the front desk.

The building makes for a nice little walk around to see Beethoven’s instruments, diaries and portraits of his family. It was a shame that all the panels were in German only, however. The 3D interactive opera also made for interesting, yet now quite outdated viewing. €4.50 per student ticket is a little steep for anyone but big Beethoven fans, I think.
Very good indeed. Some really fascinating exhibits. Just wish there were more detailed descriptions for some of the exhibits in languages other than Dutch.
Best Pretzel in Germany....Competitive prices ........ Good lunch on the go and breakfast packages and a friendly staff..... Yummy I cannot resist their Pretzels
Try the pizza. Yummy!!
Ok
Kaffee schmeckt sehr Metall Lastig, und Brezel zum Teil hart....
War früher mal ganz gut. Inzwischen sind die Brezeln oft ein wenig angebrannt und meistens ohne Salz. Dafür sind dann allerdings die Preise gesalzen.

Quick delicious Korean food.  Order and the food comes quick.  Service is friendly.  Menu choices are easy.  You can also pick up some Korean instant noodles or snacks.  Cozy tight seating and usually quite full.
Good hot food for a great price.   Very busy for dinner on a Tuesday.  Small joint makes for a cozy atmosphere.

Brilliantly casual Korean restaurant without any useless knick knacks, fast service, great value, authentic tasty, hot and fresh dishes.

PROs
+ Staff are real Koreans who speak fluent German
+ Very fast service
+ Great value
+ Wonderful, relaxed atmosphere
+ Lots of young (20-35) and hip people and students
+ They also sell Korean snacks, spices, sauces and packed foods: superb!

CONs
- The wooden chairs can injure your legs
- Not suitable for high maintenance dates pr corporate events
Quite delicious and affordable Korean food :)
I gotta say their food is very good. It's a Korean restaurant. But there is not much space, a little small. Btw Chop Chea is very delicious, I recommend it for all noodle lovers out there.
Very friendly staff, excellent Latte Macchiato and yummy Pizza Baguette and nice outdoor seating.

Sehr freundliche Bedienung bin vor 2 Tagen das erste mal da gewesen bis jetzt kannte ich den Laden noch nicht und muss wirklich sagen das es einfach geil geschmeckt hat !! also kann jedem nur empfehlen das Hähnchen Baguette zu probieren es ist klasse mit diesen ganzen verschiedenen Brot Sorten 5 waren es glaub ich :)
Die besten Baguettes in Bonn. Preis-Leistungsverhältnis super und nettes Personal!! 😊 Könnte jeden Tag dort essen gehen 🤤😄

Super leckes Essen, insbesondere die Suppen sind ein Traum für die Sinne! Die Baguettes, die es in verschiedenen Variationen zur Auswahl gibt,  sind ebenfalls sehr lecker. Wenns mal etwas voller ist, kann es leider ein weniger dauern bis das Essen serviert wird, aber wenn es dann soweit ist, dann hat sich das Warten auch voll und ganz gelohnt und man wird mit herrlich leckeren Baguettes/ Suppen belohnt!
Sehr leckere Baguettes, und sehr nette Bedienung. Nur zu Empfehlen!

Typical Arabic/German imbiss, good quality of shawarma (especially the chicken). The place is clean and the prices are good. There is a small sitting area available. There is no parking available and they accept only cash. The people working there are very friendly and fast to deliver your order. They are open until late(around 01:00 I believe), especially during the weekend they stay open for a longer time (if I remember correctly until 03:00).

I ate there 2 times. Quality of food is not good, the falafel and shawerma taste are not good, prices relative to the quality and quantity are high. 
I don’t recommend this place to anyone
Delicious Arabic and Turkish food, good service
Superbly delicious and has a reasonable price
Cheap and tasty food, specially Donner and pizza.

A very good restaurant at Bonn City with huge of meals at their menu card. If you have not enough time for lunch, then this restaurant is the best decision to visit. The price is acceptable and the taste of the meals are good. You can get also a nice ice cream for dessert.
Huge and hearty meals. The own brewed beer is really tasty and easy to drink. The get a place a reservation, especially for bigger groups is recommended. I enjoyed the evening
Cool local restaurant. That have they own beer, that is white nice.
Touristic but worth the visit anyway. Great traditional beer and food. Delicious!

Great local restaurant with classic German food, I was invited here with some colleagues and enjoyed very much the food. Also the beer was really nice and in their special glasses. Would go back here when I am in Bonn again. Very nice decorated as well at the entrance for Christmas just close by the Christmas market in the center.
I really like this place.  Excellent food at reasonable prices, and very friendly service.  It's also an excellent location, right across the street from the Bonn cathedral.

A great place. So clean and comfortable. Greaaat service and super kind people. The food is also TipTop 👌🏼 and the coffee is great. I go there 1-2 times a month and had never a problem with anything. I am a big fan of this great restaurant :)

We arrived with no reservation and were accommodated with a smile. The breakfast menu was small but diverse so certainly something for all tastes. We had a great time, enjoyed our breakfast,  very friendly staff and English was no problems at all.. Highly recommended from me..
It is a nice restaurant with decent food at affordable price. Suitable for big groups.
Lovely pizza, friendly but very slow service

I read about this restaurant before visiting Bonn as my daughter is vegan. 3 of us had lovely meals here. One is vegan, one vegetarian and the other a meat eater and all had great meals. Easy to choose and not too busy and a fair price. I would definitely come here again.

I like this place a lot! The location is very nice and cozy. They offer a wide range of yummy salads and vegitarian foods. The food was very good. It's a self-service buffet where you pay by the weight of your meal. The staff were very friendly, would come here again any time!

The food is great, fresh and delicious. There is a wide variety of dishes in the restaraunt as well as many cakes or ice cream in the bar. Vegans feel at home here. The personal is also welcoming and nice. It is a bit expensive, but it's totally worth it. will definitely come back again.
lovely place and perfectly located to eat vegetarian and vegan in Bonn
Homemade-like meals, all allergenes are clearly stated. The vegan food is lovely. Good price!
Very good food
Mein absolutes Lieblingsrestaurant ❤️  bester Kellner! Das Restaurant ist klein aber fein. Einfach herrlich! ... leider ist das Restaurant nach dem Tod des Besitzers\Koch geschlossen. 😥

Ein absolut wundervolles Restaurant um nicht zu sagen, das beste welches mir bekannt ist. Das Essen schmeckt ausgezeichnet. Durch die gemütliche und äußerst stilvolle Wohnzimmeratmosphäre fühlt man sich sehr wohl. Auch die überaus charmante Bedienung des Restaurants trägt sehr dazu bei, dass ein Abend beim Caminetto immer zu einem tollen Erlebnis wird.

Ein gehobenes italienisches Restaurant, welches hervorragende Speisen und einen sehr zuvorkommenden Service bietet. Wir sind jedes Mal auf's neue begeistert, wenn wir dort sind! Eine absolute Empfehlung, wenn man gutes Essen, einen klasse Service und tolles Ambiente zu schätzen weiß.

Klein, fein, Wohnzimmeratmosphäre. 
Das Essen ist ausgezeichnet, und man kann es in aller Ruhe genießen. Michele, der Kellner, ist ein absoluter Profi: Sehr aufmerksam, freundlich und diskret. Wenn er am Tisch den Fisch putzt, um dann die Filets.vorzulegen, ganz großes Kino. In der Küche regiert der Chef persönlich.
Fazit: 5 Sterne +
Amazing service, really really fast. Amazing food and it's not expensive 5 stars!
different and creative in its own way....many dishes are really good while service is friendly. would like to go there again.
Extremely popular spot. Can get very crowded. Definitely make reservations. Great food in a cosy restaurant.

An interesting but erratic restaurant. Made a reservation for two adults and three children and arrived on time. Noticed that there were tables outside and my wife asked if we could sit at one. Man behind the counter said we couldn't and used a tone of voice and phrasing that was rude, inappropriate and condescending. 0/10 for his customer service skills. (If the restaurant is reading this: he had a broken leg - that should help you identify the culprit) Seemed like the waitress who showed us to our table noticed and was extra pleasant to us and our kids and remained so throughout. So full 10/10 for her. A second waitress, frowned more than smiled, and bluntly gave us advice on how *she* wanted us to progress with ordering food. Her intentions may have been good, but again it came across more as a stern warning than a piece of helpful advice - 3/10 for her.

Moving on to the food. Their signature dish is a plate with about 9 mini portions of different dishes on it (like a degustation menu). You eat them all and then you pick three of your favourites which are served to you in a larger but not large portions. After you have eaten all of these you can go on ordering any of the 9 items until you are full. It's an interesting idea but it is labour intensive for the staff, and as the restaurant fills up, the service gets much slower and forgetful. 

From our selection of 9 items, I chose: Lamb Ragout which was ordinary. The meat was bordering on the tough which is surprising for a long cooked dish. The Oriental paprika cream soup was enjoyable. The falafel were awful - no salt for pity’s sake, did the chef actually taste one? The Börek were nice, light and crispy and popular, but each time you ordered them you only got one which made me wonder if it was a tactic to reduce the number you ate. The Egyptian rice with pasta dish looked interesting but was a bland and inconsequential. The Iranian melon and goat's cheese salad was nice and refreshing and another spicy salad dish was good too.

To sum up our evening, I was a bit underwhelmed by the food (my wife who had been before said it had been better) and the service would have been poor to bad had it not been for the single 'star waitress' 

For us, it might be worth going again as the contents of the signature dish changes periodically. But then I think of Mr Rude and wonder if we can be bothered.

L'endroit est très sympa. La salle à été rénovée depuis ma dernière venue il y a quelques années. Mes souvenirs du repas n'ont pas été déçus. Le concept du menu Karawane est original (on goûte les 9 plats puis on choisit ensuite les 3 que l'on veut, autant de fois que l'on souhaite), avec des plats qui sont vraiment bons. Le seul petit bémol c'est l'attente entre les plats, trop longue à mon goût.
QUIET simple great place for after work Spero, you can talk with no background noise

Always dingey and dark with very odd opening hours.

Meh!
Great restaurant
Traditional fantastic service
Great atmosphere
